snippet: New York lawmakers have reservations about the governor’s plan to give rebates to homeowners whose property taxes increase.
abstract: New York lawmakers, in rare bipartisan rebuke, reject Gov Andrew M Cuomo's plan to temporarily freeze property taxes for two years by giving rebates to homeowners; complain that proposal, one of centerpieces of Cuomo's proposed budget, could allow governor to exert undue influence on municipal and school budgets and might disproportionately benefit taxpayers in wealthy communities.
lead_paragraph: New York lawmakers have reservations about the governor’s plan to give rebates to homeowners whose property taxes increase.

headline.main: Legislature Rejects Cuomo’s Plan to Use Rebates to Freeze Property Taxes
headline.print_headline: Legislature Rejects Cuomo’s Plan to Use Rebates to Freeze Property Taxes
